intro: Luzula taurica, commonly known as the Taurian sedge, is a perennial plant native to the Caucasus region and parts of southern Russia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wet meadows. Its slender, triangular stems are often covered in dense, grass-like foliage. Luzula taurica produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
